sent_question: he enjoys walking in the woods alone?
not all of the movies at the theater are comedies?
he doesn't like eating at fancy restaurants?
not all of the cookies at the bakery are chocolate?
sent_manipulation: John spends a lot of time with his family.
John has seen every movie at the theater.
Bob ate one of the cookies but hasn't been to the bakery himself.
sent_context: John and Bob were talking about sailing yesterday.
Yesterday, John and Bob were talking about the movies at a local theater.
John and Bob were talking about restaurants yesterday.
A few days ago, John and Bob were talking about the current selection of cookies at a local bakery.
expt_aim: To test how people interpret certain grammatical situations
sent_inference: I enjoy going sailing with my father.
Some of the movies at the theater are comedies.
I don't like eating out at upscale places.
Some of the cookies at the bakery are chocolate.
speaker: John
John
John
Bob
character_thoughts: I think they're really bland people
